column4: I did an upgrade on Edgy and it rendered my system unbootable by modifying my fstab to use some long ID's
is there a way to fix this?
is anyone else ending up with an unbootable system after an upgrade in Edgy?
not unbootable, but the nvidia drivers dont work (here anyway)
I don't have the nvidia problem I wish it were only that
you can always boot from the CD if necessary
yeah but my HD will be inaccessible won't it?
not if you do it the right way; you can use the kernel on the cd and tell it to use your hard drive as the root partition
have a url for me that tells me how?
nvm I will check the wiki
im looking to see if i can find a link
btw I have the alternative install CD for Edgy
I cant remember exactly, but you should be able to edit the boot options on the grub menu on that cd, and tell the kernel "initrd=/dev/hd....."
where you pass in the device that has your / partition
